decks.notes: The focus of this deck is to control the game through a combination of counter spells, removal, and card advantage. Utilizing a mix of creature removal, hand disruption, counter spells, and card draw, Dimir Control aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while gaining incremental advantages. With the ability to efficiently answer threats and disrupt the opponent's plans, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and eventually win with powerful threats like Murktide Regent. The key to success lies in carefully managing resources and strategically disrupting the opponent's strategy.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's actions through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and powerful planeswalkers. It aims to disrupt and stall the opponent's game plan while generating card advantage through cards like Narset, Parter of Veils and Teferi, Time Raveler. The deck also has the ability to quickly find answers with cards like Telling Time and Meticulous Archive. By maintaining a strong defensive position and efficiently handling threats, the deck aims to outlast the opponent and eventually overwhelm them with powerful finishers like Terminus and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria.

The deck focuses on utilizing artifacts and mana acceleration to quickly flood the board with threats. By using cards like Mox Opal and Springleaf Drum to ramp up mana, along with creatures like Memnite and Ornithopter to establish a strong board presence, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. Cards like Arcbound Ravager and Weapons Manufacturing provide additional aggression and synergy with artifacts. Urza's Saga helps to tutor for key pieces and provide additional threats. The deck aims to close out the game quickly before the opponent can respond effectively.

The deck focuses on using control elements such as counterspells and removal spells to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating value through card draw and token creation. It also includes powerful finishers like Phage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Galvanic Discharge to close out the game. The deck aims to control the board, outvalue the opponent, and ultimately win through a combination of removal and powerful threats. Additionally, it utilizes cards like Consign to Memory and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer to further disrupt the opponent's strategy and maintain control of the game.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana and play Primeval Titan to fetch lands like Simic Growth Chamber and bounce lands back to hand for extra mana. The deck utilizes Amulet of Vigor to untap lands and get extra value from them. The combo potential comes from cards like Scapeshift and Aftermath Analyst, allowing for explosive turns where many lands are put into play at once. The deck also includes protection with cards like Boseiju, Who Endures and access to toolbox cards with Green Sun's Zenith.

This deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures and control the board with various removal spells. It aims to overwhelm the opponent with large threats like Emrakul, the Promised End and Sire of Seven Deaths while also disrupting their strategy with cards like Kozilek's Command and Malevolent Rumble. The deck utilizes cards like Utopia Sprawl and Eldrazi Temple to accelerate mana production and is supplemented with additional control elements like Ghost Quarter and Ugin, Eye of the Storms to maintain board dominance.

The deck focuses on generating quick mana through rituals and medallions to cast a high volume of spells and create a storm count for a devastating finish with cards like Grapeshot. It also utilizes card draw spells like Reckless Impulse and Wish to find combo pieces quickly. Ral, Monsoon Mage provides additional spell copying capabilities, while Wrenn's Resolve protects key combo pieces. The deck includes land fetch cards like Wooded Foothills and Scalding Tarn for consistency in mana base and spell recursion cards like Past in Flames for resilience.

The main concept of this deck is to generate mana quickly and efficiently through cards like Pyretic Ritual and Ruby Medallion, while also drawing through the deck using cards like Reckless Impulse and Valakut Awakening. The deck aims to abuse the storm mechanic with cards like Ral, Monsoon Mage and Grapeshot to deal massive amounts of damage in a single turn. By utilizing cards that can recur spells from the graveyard like Past in Flames, the deck can create explosive combo turns to overwhelm the opponent and secure the win.

This deck focuses on maximizing the power of multicolored creatures and spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. By utilizing Leyline of the Guildpact and Leyline Binding to boost the effectiveness of multicolored cards like Scion of Draco and Territorial Kavu, the deck aims to control the board and deal heavy damage. Cards like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer provide additional pressure, while cards like Stubborn Denial and Teferi, Time Raveler help protect your own board and disrupt the opponent's strategy.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by using a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and powerful legendary creatures. It aims to answer opponent's threats efficiently while also establishing its own win conditions through powerful creatures such as Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury. The deck also utilizes versatile cantrips like Galvanic Discharge and Consign to Memory for card advantage and manipulation. By managing the board state and card advantage, the deck seeks to outvalue and outlast opponents in the long game.

This deck is focused on generating a large amount of mana quickly through spells like Pyretic Ritual and Desperate Ritual, along with the help of Ruby Medallion. It also utilizes the card advantage from cards like Manamorphose and Reckless Impulse to dig through the deck for combo pieces like Ral, Monsoon Mage. The main win condition is either casting a large Grapeshot or using Past in Flames to recur spells and finish off the opponent with a storm combo. The deck aims to be fast and efficient in its spellcasting to overwhelm the opponent.

The deck focuses on utilizing creatures with various abilities to assemble a powerful combination that can overwhelm opponents. By leveraging cards like Green Sun's Zenith and Dredger's Insight, the deck can search for key creatures and draw more cards to maintain its resources. With a mix of aggressive creatures like Young Wolf and versatile options like Endurance and Yawgmoth, Thran Physician, the deck can adapt to different situations and disrupt opponents' strategies. By using a toolbox approach, the deck can access the right tools needed to secure victory in various matchups.

This deck focuses on using artifacts to quickly and aggressively build up a board presence, utilizing cards like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Mox Opal to generate value. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Metallic Rebuke and Unholy Heat to control the opponent's board and push for a fast win. The inclusion of cards like Urza's Saga and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student allows for card advantage and further board development. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with early threats and efficient plays to secure victory.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with aggressive creatures. Utilizing cards like Path to Exile, Force of Negation, and Field of Ruin to disrupt the opponent's strategy, while creatures like Solitude and Subtlety provide removal and evasion. Teferi, Time Raveler helps control the tempo of the game and protect your creatures. White Orchid Phantom and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd provide additional threats and card advantage. The deck aims to control the board and disrupt the opponent's resources while steadily advancing its own game plan to secure a victory.

The main concept of this Control - UrzaTron deck is to assemble the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Tower, Urza's Power Plant, and Urza's Mine) to produce a large amount of mana quickly. This mana is then used to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger and Thought-Knot Seer, as well as planeswalkers like Karn, the Great Creator and Ugin, the Eye of the Storms. The deck also includes disruption spells like Kozilek's Command and Sowing Mycospawn to control the game and interact with the opponent's strategy. Additionally, Expedition Map is used to tutor for specific lands needed for the combo.

This deck focuses on utilizing artifact creatures and artifacts to create a fast-paced aggressive strategy. By using cards like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Mishra's Bauble to generate card advantage and mana acceleration, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly with a combination of threats and disruption. Urza's Saga helps to tutor for key artifacts while Metallic Rebuke and Unholy Heat provide efficient removal and counterspells to protect the aggressive game plan. The deck's synergy and speed make it a formidable force in Modern 1 vs 1 matches.
